titleStmt.title: Edwin F. Corey, Jr. to James W. Tate
CWG2425

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

creation.placeName: New York, New York County, New York

body.p:
New York February 12th 1861.
Honle James W. Tate.
Assnt Secretary of State
State of Kentucky.
Dr Sir.

On my return to my office after an absence of some time. I find a letter from you stating that you have never received from me my oath of office as Commissioner for your State I find on examination that through an oversight it has never been forwarded to you. for which I beg leave to apologize.
Enclosed you will find the required document together with your fee ($500) the receipt of which please acknowledge.

Very Respy
Your obt Sevt
Edwin F. Corey Jun

New York
Comr. of Deeds
Oath
E. F. Corey Jr
